review_title: CTMC is a really special place
job_title: PR Coordinator in San Marcos, TX
pros:
The biggest pro for me was that CTMC is very generous with their PTO. The parent company, Adventist Health System, really does prioritize work-life balance for its employees.

I also found the culture to be a positive and uplifting one. There are a lot of smiling, friendly faces (especially the volunteers). I really enjoyed the faith-based aspect. If you are offended by prayer, don't work here. 

One of the things I miss the most is the hospital's cafe. Employees are able to payroll deduct discounted meals with their ID badge. There is a colorful salad bar and usually other healthy options as well. The mile-long walking trail that circles the campus is also great for staying active. These things make it more convenient for employees to incorporate wellness into their daily lives. 

The pay was pretty decent.

CTMC is a growing hospital that has added several service lines and new technology during the past several years.
cons: During my time there, I had a few supervisors. I noticed there was a high turnover in management, and it seemed that people were sometimes let go for personality conflicts even when their performance was good.

review_title: Wouldn't want to work anywhere else!

job_title: Medical Scientist in San Marcos, TX
pros:
This hospital sticks to its faith base, and also creates a "family-like" atmosphere.  Because we are a smaller hospital, everyone knows everyone. So, communication between departments are easy with more face to face time, rather than sent electronically. There can never be enough communication, but CTMC achieves at covering different approaches. 

CTMC is also not afraid to acknowledge hard workers, or great jobs. It might sound irrelevant because "it’s your job", but it means the world to have leadership recognize you when you done a great job or just went the extra mile.

CTMC Leadership is outstanding. This is one of the first places I work, where the leaders involve everyone on the team. They are not afraid to train employees for leadership role, while at the same time making sure those individuals meet the requirements for a leader. It’s not about "experience" at CTMC, because the only way you get that is with time. What CTMC looks for employees who are team players, and who communicate with not only employees but patients. CTMC does not let bias or favoritism play a role, but rather "is that individual the right person for the job". The leaders here focus and give you task based on your strengths, and at the same time strengthen your weak.
Coming to work here was probably one of the best career moves I have ever made. 

One of the biggest pros I have seen at this hospital is CTMC's commitment to the community well being. Just about every function in San Marcos, Texas you can expect to see a CTMC booth or sponsor logo. 

Leadership, including the CEO, come by and visit EVERY department and person which is nice to see.
cons: This isn't a CTMC con but rather a EVERY hospital con. At every hospital, besides physician, the next best thing are nurses. It seems nurses will always get the go ahead before ancillary departments. To be fair, nurses are the front line of the hospital, but it would be nice to see hospitals not just CTMC highlight other ancillary career opportunities in the hospital. I wouldn't say remove nurses from the pedestal where they stand, but rather elevate the ancillary departments to that level as well.
